anecdotecandles: Thank you for your candor and transparency! We need more of this.
robinboyko: Thanks for being an awesome successful woman that is truthful about her behavioral health struggles. azcostello: I am really happy for you. And that explanation is so accurate.
chowarddc: About a 7 myself. I barely know me!
kristinnelena: I appreciate your transparency. It’s giving me hope getting back on my medicine, after a month of not knowing who the fuck I was and being angry at myself for not being able to accomplish the most simple of tasks
fastmaddy: I was in a depressed state for 4 yrs living in a city and state that I didn't connect with or feel at home in. The depression led to unhealthy amounts of drinking and eating in excess. Going out with friends and walking around would help a smidge but when laying in my bed I was alone with my thoughts of anxiety, sadness and feeling meh about life. Then a trip abroad, my first time traveling alone, changed my mood. Some how I felt empowered and recharged unlike ever before. I realized that some days it's ok if all you want to do is sleep and unplug from the world. Constantly filling my day with activities and people wasn't healthy. I needed more me time. Then I decided to get the fuck out of dodge, did a solo cross country epic road trip back to what I had always considered home. It's been 3 yrs since that decision had been made. 4 minutes ago, the movers left, my stuff is finally in my new home. It took some time readjusting but with each little step things are looking less meh and more hopeful... anxiety is present. I'm currently at an 8.5... with no outside influencers.
lynseyacraig: Constant battle. The fog seems thicker this time of year. Day at a time x
mreen14: Very happy for you!! and so appreciate your authentic and open posts. Helpful for me to understand how this affects people

stephurwitz: I watched your feed and wrote down that quote. Says it perfectly! Thanks for being you!

honeymyheart: So good to hear this, and see you Shine.
